intro: Ribes ussuriense, commonly known as Ussuri gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the genus Ribes in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green berries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. The berries are edible and have a tart flavor, making them useful in culinary applications.
